intro: Bourreria schatziana, commonly known as the Mexican whitebeard. It is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America, belonging to the Asteraceae family. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, and it often grows in dry, rocky soils. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
